author: Joseph De Avila
title: Connecticut Lawmakers Propose Open Competition to Build Casino
text:
State legislators from Bridgeport on Tuesday proposed a bill that would call for an open competition to build a new casino in Connecticut, creating an opportunity for MGM Resorts International, while possibly straining the stateâ€™s relationship with the Indian tribes that manage the other casinos in the state.
At least four Democratic lawmakers suggested holding a bidding contest among developers to determine who would get to build a new casino in Connecticut. Two tribes currently have exclusive rights to run casinos in the... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
